instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashing from installing google chrome
threads.message: I have replaced the <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> already as i do for all the 2010 years that come in now and my assistant noticed that google chrome is causing the computer to crash and makes the chime go away when it starts back up.  as soon as chrome is installed and he opens it it crashes.  its behaving like they do before the <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> is replaced.  as soon as we uninstall chrome it works 100% again no crashing. he also noticed the same thing a few months back on a 2009.  has anyone seen this before?  just wondering if chrome has a software glitch or something else here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashing from installing google chrome
threads.message: what happens if you disable hardware acceleration in chrome? can these machines run furmark for 30 minutes without crashing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashing from installing google chrome
threads.message: Run ASD for RAM test and run Heaven or Furmark to test GPU.
